item.title: Algorithms - Graphs
item.description: Undirected Graphs Some problems Path Shortest path Cycle Ehler tour: A cycle that uses each edge excatly once. Hamilton tour: A cycle that uses each vertex exactly once classical NP-complete problem. Connectivity MST: Biconnectivity: A vertex whose removal disconnects the graph Planarity Graph isomorphism: Are two graphs identical? No one knows so far. A lonstanding open problem Representations Real-world graphs tend to be sparse (huge number of vertices, small average vertex degree).
